text: I'm usually a bit skeptical of the need to make sure a request can only come from your site, or only come from parts of the site you approve

open

text: This is my code.

elements.text: This is my code.

<body>
    -> session_start
    
    <form  class="text-center" action="/accounting/postkonto.prg" method="post">    
        -> FORMVIEW
    </form>                
    
    <script type="text/javascript">
        
        $(document).ready(function() {
            $("#kontonummer").val( viewName.kontonummer );
            $("#bezeichnung").val( viewName.bezeichnung );
            $("#datum").val( viewName.datum );
            
        });
        
        window.onload=my_code();
        
        function my_code(){
            |- place here the eventlistener
            
            $-> EVENTLISTENERBYNAME   1: name=kontonummer ; 
            $-> EVENTLISTENERBYNAME   2: name=bezeichnung  ; 
            $-> EVENTLISTENERBYNAME   12: name=datum  ; 
            
        } 
        
        var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
        xhr.onprogress = function() {
            if (xhr.readyState === XMLHttpRequest.DONE) {
                // do something
            }
        });
        xhr.open("POST", "http://your/url");
        xhr.setRequestHeader("Content-Type", "application/json");
        xhr.send(sessionStorage.getItem("WINHOTELGenesis"));
    </script>
</body>

Now I will go ahead with editing.
When calling konto.prg I need to set a buffer.
So I can check when I save my data whether the data still matches the original status.

In the meantime, another user could have changed the data record and I would simply overwrite the data.

In postkonto.prg I have to check the "buffer" against the current data.
If everything fits, then save the data, otherwise provide a push-off method.

konto.prg
METHOD SetBuffer

postkonto.prg
 METHOD Modified()

 METHOD Save()

elements.text:
Now I will go ahead with editing.
When calling konto.prg I need to set a buffer.
So I can check when I save my data whether the data still matches the original status.

In the meantime, another user could have changed the data record and I would simply overwrite the data.

In postkonto.prg I have to check the "buffer" against the current data.
If everything fits, then save the data, otherwise provide a push-off method.

konto.prg
METHOD SetBuffer

postkonto.prg
 METHOD Modified()

 METHOD Save()
